query: When did Gulfstream implement new forecasting analytics?
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: When did Gulfstream implement new forecasting analytics?

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[Report of Preliminary Hearing and Scheduling Order (002).docx, p.1]
GULFSTREAM AEROSPACE CORPORATION,

[Full Prelim Cross List.docx, p.1]
C. Discussion of the 'loaned labor' from other Gulfstream sites.

[Full Prelim Cross List.docx, p.1]
C. How did Gulfstream balance resource allocation among projects?

[Full Prelim Cross List.docx, p.1]
B. Claimed Gulfstream couldn’t assess prior condition—true?

[Full Prelim Cross List.docx, p.1]
C. Does that align with Gulfstream’s duty of care?

[Full Prelim Cross List.docx, p.1]
Leonard Beauchemin – Expert Witness for Gulfstream

[Full Prelim Cross List.docx, p.1]
B. Opinions based solely on Gulfstream-provided records.

[Damage Summary Handout for Tribunal.docx, p.1]
CITIOM v. Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation

[Damage Summary Handout for Tribunal.docx, p.1]
Legal Theory: Gulfstream provided a materially misleading proposal—quoting 2,800 labor hours and 35–45 business days—despite having internal forecasting tools, prior inspection data, and knowledge of the Aircraft’s service history.

[Damage Summary Handout for Tribunal.docx, p.1]
Legal Theory: Gulfstream breached its duty to exercise reasonable care in performance and planning. It failed to manage labor, escalation, and communication, resulting in massive deviation from quoted timeline and cost.

[207-329.pdf, p.81]
What strategies are we implementing to pull RTS left?

[Charles Philipp Outline #1.docx, p.1]
You never ensured a fast-track or exception process was proposed or implemented.

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
I was not aware at the time I received the Proposal, at the time I directed Avcon to sign the Proposal, or at the time the Aircraft was delivered to St. Louis - that Gulfstream was developing or had implemented a new analytical tool, or any technology, that would or should impact their proposals (including their ability to assess and predict costs and downtime for aircraft maintenance and repairs).

[CITIOM v. Gulfstream - LB Expert Rebuttal Report (4-21-25).pdf, p.11]
implemented a fleetwide inspection and repair program that required ultrasonic inspection



Based on document search, key findings:
- Found relevant excerpts in repository documents
- See excerpts above for specific citations
